Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the chances of Fred Keller winning the election, stating that he was a "50-50 shot" before his landslide victory, when in reality he was considered the prohibitive favorite by independent political analysts.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the assertion that Keller's chances were rated as 50-50 before the election.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Keller's victory was unexpected or surprising, when in fact the district he was running in is solidly Republican and heavily favored him.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation to the claim is that President Trump may have been trying to emphasize Keller's victory by presenting it as more remarkable than it actually was, possibly for political purposes.
